us.pserver.revok.servlet

Class ServletConfigUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.pserver.revok.servlet.ServletConfigUtil

  • public class ServletConfigUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for reading web.xml config file.
    Version:
    1.1 - 201506
    Author:
    Juno Roesler - juno@pserver.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServletConfigUtil(javax.servlet.ServletConfig sc)
      Default constructor which receives the ServletConfig configuration object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListParam(java.lang.String name)
      Return the value of an init parameter as java.util.List<String>, where this value is a String, colon separated parameters (i.e: param1,param2,param3...).
      java.util.List<ServletObjectParam> getObjectParamList(java.lang.String name)
      Return the value of an init parameter converted as java.util.List<ServletObjectParam>, where this value is a String, colon separated parameters (i.e: param1,param2,param3...).
      java.lang.String getParam(java.lang.String name)
      Get the value of an init parameter.
      javax.servlet.ServletConfig getServletConfig()
      Get the ServletConfig configuration object.
      boolean hasParam(java.lang.String name)
      Verifies if the ServletConfig contains an init parameter with the specified name.

      • getServletConfig

        public javax.servlet.ServletConfig getServletConfig()
        Get the ServletConfig configuration object.

      • hasParam

        public boolean hasParam(java.lang.String name)
        Verifies if the ServletConfig contains an init parameter with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the parameter to be verified.
        Returns:
        true if the ServletConfig has an init parameter with the specified name, false otherwise

      • getListParam

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListParam(java.lang.String name)
        Return the value of an init parameter as java.util.List<String>, where this value is a String, colon separated parameters (i.e: param1,param2,param3...).
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the init parameter.
        Returns:
        A List with the parameters.

      • getObjectParamList

        public java.util.List<ServletObjectParam> getObjectParamList(java.lang.String name)
        Return the value of an init parameter converted as java.util.List<ServletObjectParam>, where this value is a String, colon separated parameters (i.e: param1,param2,param3...).
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the init parameter.
        Returns:
        A List with the parameters.

      • getParam

        public java.lang.String getParam(java.lang.String name)
        Get the value of an init parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the init parameter.
        Returns:
        String value of the init parameter.
